result.execSummary:
The defendant Alyssa Audrey Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  The defendant has thirty (30) days to make payment of any amount ordered unless other arrangements are made with the Clerk of Court's office. Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    

Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Alyssa Audrey Anderson
Current: 2725 County Rd Q, Clear Lake, WI 54005 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2022)
Prior: 7513 Hickory St W, Webster, WI 54893

11:29 AM Cases 22CF17 and 21TR928 called together.  Defendant, Alyssa Audrey Anderson, appeared by phone, with Attorney Daniel James Chapman by video.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.    Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Court reviews defendant's right to appear in person and that she is waiving the right today, she understands.  Agreement is recited: Defendant will plead to amended count of misd. Possession of THC, joint recommendation for costs only. Mr. Chapman agreese.  DA makes formal motion to amend to misd. simple possession of THC.  Court grants.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Defs constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for plea. 
 Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds defendant guilty of  Misdemeanor Possession of THC and orders a JOC.  Remaining count and case 21TR928 are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def does not make statement to the Court.  Court Orders:  $200 DNA surcharge, 30 days to pay or work out payment plan.  Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.

09:08 AM Cases 22CF17 and 21TR928 called together.  Defendant, Alyssa Audrey Anderson, appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  Case 22CF17 on for Arraignment.  Atty Chapman notes an agreement is for plea to possession of THC with a joint recommendation of a fine.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

03:06 PM Called 21TR928 for STC and 22CF17 for PH.  Defendant, Alyssa Audrey Anderson, appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  All parties appeared in person.  Case 22CF17 is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Captain Julie Mead, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made. Attny Chapman has no questions. Court questions witness on identification, confirms identification is made. Witness steps down.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information.  Status conference and ARGN scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
